Sauveur de chats Mush

Garanti sans Schrödinger infecté

Utilisez le script associé pour récupérer les canaux dans un format utilisable.

Titre de la partie

Canal général

Canal général

Favoris

Les favoris seront ajoutés au-dessus des autres messages du canal général. Si vous pouvez encore le faire, défavorisez-les et copiez à nouveau le canal général pour qu'ils soient placés correctement.

Groupe de canaux

Canal privé

Une fois les canaux ajoutés, enregistrez cette page (Fichier → Enregistrer sous, ou Ctrl+S ; pas en favoris !). Vous pouvez y ajouter d'autres canaux par la suite, mais n'oubliez pas d'enregistrer au fur et à mesure.

Ian :

Eden Important Decisions: Seeing as we will soon jump to Eden, I thought we should do some important decision making.

1. What do we really want to call our new Home System? Our Home Planet? And our Capital City?

2. What kind of governement type do we want? Democracy, Dictatorship, Monarchy or Anarchy? Any other ideas?

3. Who will our first leader on that planet be? Obvious canditates would be Jin Su, Ian Soulton and Gioele Rinaldo. Anyone else?

4. Other points to take up?

5. Questions

6.

7. It has been a great trip with everyone, I hope we can make Eden great and totally eradicate the mush fungus.

8. ((OOC: I would have used the eden icon ontop, but I dont have it unlocked, even though I went to Eden on the french server on a casting, though I dont think that counted or atleast I cant use it here. Otherwise I would use Sol icon, but I dont know if that even exists and if it does I dont know the code, wiki didnt help either...))

Ancre
Montrer les réponses
Ian :

Also, yes this IS important, if we dont do this we wont be considered a real galactic civilization, it is important for the future of all of us, our children, their children and Eden.

Roland :

I like the idea of anarchy, so I won't reply it the right order. That will be my first act of rebellion. And second, why on Sol would we be governed by a man ? We can live on Dead Kraken Island, New Tortuga or Merlin II, I don't care as long as women have the power. Oh, and as long as there's a good pub. One that serves good booze and not shampoo.

Jin Su :

A civilization of thirteen people, no less. But don't worry, I have an idea or two of how to fix that. He adjusts his top button.

A lot of these, we'll figure out as we go. The first order of business is to set up a living space for the people we have. It needs to be safe and have all the resources we need to live. Then we can move on to bigger and greater things, like infrastructure, research, gardening, mining, and so forth. No need to rush to any decisions, though there isn't much harm in the discussion.

Well. Not unless we let ourselves get bogged down in what-ifs that are not presently relevant. I do expect the leadership question to be an important issue for some, though.

Hua :

Blah. Regarding the leader it's obvious. I really can't imagine anybody more qualified, or more charismatic.. than the Great Long John Jumkin. Even if I'm a little worried by RInaldo's influence lately, he's still hell of a Pirate plant. You'd be a crappy leader Ian. I like you, but you're a running gag, you keep fighting with furniture and getting hurt by stupid random objects... What a great example. Nah. People need a hero, and in Long John Jumkin, they'll have it.

The planet already have a name, I'm sure we'll find it in the maps kept in the treasures chest buried here and there. And shouldn't we think of building an actual village before considering a capital city?

As a Pirate I don't care much about politics. I like my freedom above everything, I like being able to take off and go on adventure if the winds blows this way. I like the unknown, and the thrill of discovering new worlds, secret artefacts.. I'm too young to settle down.

Once I've found the treasure of the Old Legendary Pirate, I'll check for maps and clues and start a new quest, exploring the farthest places of this galaxy. It's been a while since our last expedition, and I already crave for new planets and wild landscape, I've this in me blood. Can't help it.

But if you build me a pub, you can be sure I'll always find an excuse to drop me anchor by the place, and have a round o'rum or two with me old mates.

Jin Su :

Clears his throat loudly. Anyway, one of the first missions I plan to organize - should the pilots be up for the job - is to pop back along our travel path with the Daedalus, after we've serviced it and set up our labs and workshops. The plan? He smiles. Rescue missions.

One of the problems we were always going to have longterm with a colony is population. Limited genetic samples here, though not too bad given the scope of the project. But there is a source of colonists right under our noses - or at least, that have been swarming us this whole time.

I propose disable-and capture missions. If we can synthesize enough of the cure, we can turn Mush attackers into reinforcements. Colonists. Community. And eventually, re-conquest.

Ian :

And how are you going to make more of the cure then?

Jin Su :

I think you did great Ian, it was very entertaining for sure! Personally I try to make my characters pretty extreme and funky to spice things up, it really adds more to the RP than to completely follow their generic Mush biography.

Gioele :

Mildly. Everyone who was unconfirmed had varying levels of suspicion. Well, except me who ended up being invited to the only human thread. Probably for how I aggressive I was and how surprised Roland was when I attacked him.

As for you, I think there was one instance of you getting dirty doing research? The main suspects ended up being Kuan Ti and Paola (after Xyloph confirmed Janice, that is).

Paola getting dirty right after selection was a red flag, especially when there were many people (including myself) who could've built the sofa for her. After that she was pretty believable, though.

Basically, we were looking at Kuan Ti pretty much the entire time. Slow progress, and it was clear he was relying on using his Designer points to look more helpful than he was being. I wouldn't doubt he extracted spores that time he got dirty. I wonder what you were planning after Roland was killed, Kuan Ti.

Janice :

Can we see the human channel if it's still up?

Ian :

Well I actualy got dirty due to Raluca picking up the apron right before I did, so I believed I picked it up, did research, and exactly that one time I got dirty... Though I belive we had mycoalarms completed by then already, so 10 rooms on the ship could be covered, so basicly even if I was mush the spore wouldnt do much for me beyond phagocyte or maybe a trap in BB or something.

Gioele :

And yeah, we weren't really looking at you for long, Ian. We were staring pretty intently at Kuan Ti. We eventually became sure when we were checking people for starvation, as he hadn't eaten and wasn't starving at the moment he should've been.

Ian :

Chun :

I just wait a bit till people finish their things and then proceed - no annoyance guaranteed

Gioele :

Yeah, I don't generally jump on people unless it's a really dire situation. In the case of Roland, either he was an unfortunate mush with his setting askew or he was going to be a troll-y problem human. Not to mention it was clear he was building AP for something (Which proved correct when he made a move, luckily he panicked).

As a mush hunter, it's good to let people make mistakes, store them up and gather a good pile of evidence without letting any of it get out the public. It's much easier for a mush to screw up when he doesn't know he's being watched.

It's sometimes also a good idea to pace research. If you rush research and get a bunch out in one day, it might incite an early rampage. And, yes, you might say "Well as long as the techs survive", but really nobody wins in a rampage... Unless it's a really successful one that a mush can be proud of.

If you're a paranoid individual, it's good to let other people lead the mush hunt but offering your opinion is absolutely necessary. No hunter likes displaying information and people just shrugging it away. So always give some thought to it if you're ever invited to a mush hunting pm.

Eden preparations
- Heal, heal, HEAL. If we can, everyone must have full hp.
- Watch morale, comfort, do speeches.
- Cure all illnesses.
- Kill hunters (duh).
- Extinguish fires.
- No repairs except for gravity simulator and command terminal.
- Water plants and treat them.
- Graft the alien fruit (anomole, precati, filandra). Remember : you must be CLEAN and the plant perfectly healthy.
- Free Gioele every cycle.
- Optional : make babies.
- Optional 2 : find a planet, load fuel, go there. Just for fun, no scan, no explo, and only at the last minute if we have AP.

Ahem, anyway. Well, I'll keep it brief. At this point, we are on fairly low alert. Our goals have been accomplished far beyond what I dared hope, and even the research has been taken about as far as we can with the material we have. All that's left is to rest, to relax, and to finalize the preparations for landing on... let's call it Eden.

What I want everyone to do is take care of each other. The ship is in rough shape and we may have some uncomfortable things to weather before we finally run PILGRED up again and make our jump. We've only been mush-free for about a week and I'm sure stress is still high.

Here's my personal medic, chart:
1 roomshake or 1 fire = No heal.
2 roomshakes or 1 roomshake and 1 fire = 1
1 steel plate = 1
1 steel plate + 1 roomshake or/ fire = 2
1 steel plate + roomshake + fire = 3

((It wasn't criticism, Frieda, it was advice. And general, not personal. We've all been overflowing AP so far, but the situation might change at any moment, which means we need to change the way we deal with "emergencies". He grumbles as a side compartment slides open to reveal a... Trident!? He grabs it and rushes back to the refectory. He twirls it with amazing ability and steps inside, diving into the coffee ocean. You can hear a massive struggle followed by a loud death roar. Gioele's panting could be heard again.
Just... Remember to heal people... If you see them injured... You dumb... Shrink...

Roland :

About injuries. The danger zone is 9 , because that's the maximum damage a combined roomshake (1-3 hp) and steel plate (4-6) can do. Sometimes a fire (2) or an electrical spike (3) can be added, which is why we heal people who have 11 hp while we can still afford it.

Roland :

Useful tip : a fire can either spread or do damage, not both. Let's say there's a fire in BD and one in RC. If things break or are destroyed in RC, it means nobody was hurt in the dorm. (It doesn't always work like that, or it's not always easy to tell.)

Precati : +1 , +1 , Cures Migraine, Cures Flu

Ian :

So it might be worthwhile to plant one of the Precati incase we get Migriane or the flu, so that that person does not have to get healed. But otherwise useless.

Roland :

Well, random illnesses usually start to appear at the same time as the ceiling keeps falling. So they get cured pretty fast, most of the time.

Roland :

I still don't know if it's worth it, though. That 1 from bananas is small but can be very useful.

Chun :

Yeah, having a voyage without a Precati would be a failure, agreed.

Chun :

Those are for planting, not hybridizing, I suppose?

Ian :

Well it does not have the healing property of the banana, but planting one of it cant hurt, if someone just so happens to have the flu or a migraine they can eat it and saves us from some AP to punch the person and heal them or just heal them if they got it from an expo and also got wounded. So I think we should have 1 Precati and rest as banana's for now. Maybe one Anemole, though it does not even have morale or health so im not just convinced about it, and especialy if we run very low on food it will be a waste of a hydropot and AP to cure tapeworm if we are forced to eat it. So I vote just planting the Precati, eating the other one and junking that sketchy Anemole.

Roland :

True, I had forgotten that we would get new hydropots soon, so that we can plant new fruits and keep our banana trees.

Roland :

((Nothing special, except that it takes 1 cycle less to mature. But it allows you to get a new plant without waiting for the old one to die.))

Ian :

Roland :

((e.g. if you have a jumpkin and all your hydropots are full, you can either wait for a plan to die, or you can graft the fruit on another plant, and it will give a bumpjunkin. Make sure to ask us the right steps and conditions when you graft for the first time, though.))

Ian :

((Thats so boring... I always thought it was like combining the plants and you get like effects from both, sometimes maybe double effects so you get like a 2AP alien banana...))

Roland :

No, it doesn't matter. You can plant a rotten fruit, it won't change anything. The conditions are being clean, and grafting on a plant that is not diseased or thirsty.

Hua :

Maybe I could just plant the Anemole tomorrow, and if we change our minds about it, graft something else on it later. It'd turn her into a young new plant depending of the fruit I'll use for grafting. I wouldn't mind some Jumpkins..

He runs both hands across his chest, displaying it.
Is not flab. This is Solid champion. A body evolution favored. This is the universal threat of "don't screw with me".
He glances at everyone with predatory eyes. You can see his face start to glisten with sweat.

He puts a finger up to stop himself.
The coffee on this ship is mine. You drink my coffee and space will drink you. I'm a Coffee Connoisseur, you wouldn't be able to appreciate it like I can... Aherm... What else?... Oh yeah, and I can do our resident witch's job just as well as her. Astrologist, yep. That's me.

Now go wallow in a pool of self pity, knowing you wont be half as good as me. You know why? Because you don't want it. You don't have the strength to earn it! Now prove me wrong or stop gloating about mocking high-pitched voice good you are at first grade arts and crafts. Bah!

Jin Su :

STATE OF THE DAEDALUS

Good afternoon, crew. I'm giving this address as a handly list of priorities in the coming days. Our ultimate goal is to locate the planet this crystal map is trying to show, but we need more information. So!

Astrophysicists: Scan planets and report your findings, so we may discuss them.
Expedition team: (Diplomats, Pilots, and those with related skills) Stay alert for when I announce expeditions, and speak up when you are available.
Pilots: Continue your duties as normal. If we have a decent wave to scrap from, we may want to take advantage.
Researchers: A splendid job so far. The last critical research is the super calculator, after which I would like you to remain open for healing duty - especially your fellow crew at the front of the ship who are closer to the medlab than the medikit. Glory research is okay if you're threatening to overflow on AP, but don't prioritize it over your crewmates.
Projects: Miss Rinaldo, are you done upgrading NERON? If so, the projects team can freely work in the Nexus until we're done. Remember to report new choices for discussion, as always.
EVERYONE: Keep an eye out for the crew around you. If you have free AP and someone nearby takes a steel plate, please heal them and report it in the health thread. This will become even more important as time goes on and the ship gets harder, so best to get in good habits now.

Carry on!

Ancre

She looks into Frieda's eyes with a dead "WATCH ME" stare.
And ignites her soaked arm, which she lift in Frieda's direction.



Wanna burn with me?

After a while she deadens the fire by suffocating it with raw steaks. After a seeping patch of scorched skin, the words "As good as Frieda" can still be read.

Jin Su :

Jin Su lies back and hums to himself for a while, but seems unsatisfied. Presently he glances out the corner of his eye at Frieda, sleeping in the bed next to his. Slight smile. Eyes narrow. Trying not to grunt in pain from his centipede wounds, he once again evokes the image of a ponderous big cat, leaving his bed without a sound and ending up in a crouch alongside the old witch's.

A boot lies innocently on the floor under the bed. The commander reaches into it and pulls out a small bottle, eyes gleaming. Success! Back into bed, painfully, silently, and then unscrew the prize. He sniffs it first, shrugs, and takes a sip. The humming resumes...

Ian :

If we have decided to become pirates we have to keep trading with mercheants to a minimum and instead plunder their ships. And once we get to land we have to plunder the scurvy land dogs instead of being friendly with them. All while dodging the royal fleet sent out to hunt the greatest pirates of the seven universes. Arr!

Jin Su :

No. No plundering. There's something off about Jin Su's voice, but it's very subtle. What is it? Definitely not. We can have a bit of fun on board if it doesn't interfere with duty, but no need to sour any relationships. Local aliens might be able to tell us the kind of colony world we're looking for. Must be good citizens. He frowns, looking at the small dark spot on his vest where he had just spilled a drop from the bottle. Now he needed to wash this before it... bleached, or something.

Gioele :

When the crew starts their shanty, Gioele instinctually starts singing along for a few words then immediately slaps himself across the face. He looks partly embarrassed and partly flustered.
Stop your singing ye fools! Ye be distracting me from my work! yar- Bah!

Paola :

Does in fact, stop singing. What she doesn't do is stop humming the tune.

Jin Su :

Jin Su hums as well, iTrackie still not transmitting, though his strict mental control seems to be wavering and the Brainsync humming oscillates between being audible and inaudible. It seems that he is making progress pulling a shanty together, from what can be heard.

Jin Su :

Jin Su can't help but grin in his slightly "medicated" state while the Daedalus jumps forward in space. He stands tall and dignified on the scooter on his return trip to the dorm, while finally letting loose the shanty he had been composing.

'Round the last ast'roid an' into deep space
(H'away ye braw crewmates, yo ho!)
Mush failed their mission, by Delzoup's kind grace
(Dodge the steel plates now, yo ho!)

(H'away ye braw crewmates, yo ho!)

Chun :

Raluca :

Raluca bolts in to the Refectory, sweaty and out of breath. You! The parrot and Raluca's eyes meet and without hesitation they leap towards each other in battle.

Bkawwwk!

Soon, it's all over. The floor is covered in blood and feathers, and Raluca stands victorious above the unconscious mister Squawkers. She takes him by the legs and disappears into the corridors, her humming eerily echoing throughout the ship.

Chun :

Chun stares at all the whole scene speechless, with her jaw dropped.. As soon as Raluca stomps out and the door slides back, her eyes slowly lower and observe the mess on the floor.. Her whole body starts shaking with the growing intense as she stares on the blood stains, so she claws back of the nearest chair, trying to keep the balance, but yet slides straight up to the floor. Shakey hands finally succeed and claim a victory over the pills bottle's cap, she throws one in her mouth, but... it falls back out the very same moment and drops on the floor. She gasps and shuts her eyes tight, trying to catch breath Ugh.. are we.. are we really that low on supplies?

Chun :

Also.. could.. could anyone.. clean that up.. please?.. Now?..

Gioele :

Are you kidding me!? That's where I get my coffee! Damn you crazy people!
He grabs a convenient, nearby mop and heads to the refectory. He frowns miserably at the scene and gets to work, making sure to take special care in cleaning the coffee maker. Within several minutes the place is spotless.
If I have to come back in here for this then it'll be someone else's blood on the floor!
He grumbles various insults as he leaves back for the bridge.

Mortimer says it's a tad risky to have so many people in AD and that this could be the perfect opportunity for the remaining mush to tip the balance in their favor. I think I will take my chances with the cabananas to relieve my hunger.

Jin Su :

ahem Well, the majority have already gathered, so... at this point you are merely excluding yourself. Which is fine I suppose, you won't be forced to do anything you don't wish to do.

Raluca :

Fine, I will join the party in AD to hear your speech. Steals Hua's leech earplugs and pops them in her ears.

Jin Su :

Mostly I'm just waiting around to see if Paola will be joining us. If that does not happen, I will deliver it with about half an hour remaining in the cycle. Plenty of time for everyone to return to their posts.

Jin Su :

Looks like we do this without her. That's fine.

Ahem. Crewmates. Friends. Jin Su draws himself up to his full height, hands clasped just in front of his solar plexus. It has been... a harrowing adventure. The early launch, the unexpected PILGRED failure, and mush in our midst. I know many of you are feeling the strain.

But we have persevered marvelously. One of the Mush agents was destroyed quickly, and I am confident the other will be rooted out in short order. We have made great strides in research, to the benefit of all humanity. Our fine pilots have turned away waves of enemies who wished to destroy us. We have some of the most practiced hands in their fields among us, and together we can ensure the success of our mission.

All of you are here because you were hand-picked for the job. Remember that as you return to work. Humanity is counting on us, and I am confident that we can deliver!

The Commander allows himself a small smile as he executes a slight, stiff bow to the assembled. His cheeks are ever-so-slightly pink from his fervor.

Janice :

That was great, Dim-Sum!

Roland :

Yawns. Great but loud. Couldn't you let us happy people sleep ?

Stephen :

Looks at Raluca Well I for one enjoyed it. He pauses and then continues I do think that that song was wrote for that reason, however I also know that the writer of it died two weeks later. I believe every word of it. He then looks to everyone else Err, what's going on? Did I just miss something?

Gioele :

A slow clap could be heard as Gioele stands up, his face isn't smiling.
Congratulations... "commander"... A very inspiration speech... One that can inspire a man... To jump off a cliff. I've heard less brown nosing in an SDF presidential campaign!

Don't listen to this foolish, withered man. We don't need compliments and to be told you're enough! Don't think about what you've done, think about what you're going to do! Think about why you're here? To save humanity? Bah! Don't lie to yourselves! We all have our reasons! We are all selfish! But a good deed done for selfish reasons is still a good deed done!

What the poor wretches on Earth see in us are saviors! The cruel reality is that you're all pansies who don't have the strength to make the hard decisions and I'm an asshole. What we do share is that we have a reason why we stepped into those cryo tubes. That reason that keeps us waking up tomorrow to pansies and assholes. Keeps us dealing with this shitty part of space inside this shittily-crafted vessel!

I'm not going to lie to you like he did. Our pilots scrape energy, barely being able to to keep the enemy ships off of us. Our scanners find volcanoes and hostiles environments. Our researcher is like a vet playing doctor! The SDF's star pupil is drowning in his drool as we speak! Our shrink has a whiny obsession with post-its! Our engineer is afflicted with space madness!

That's right, we're not humanities' finest! Now that you're all nice and angry at the real situation, I want you to realize that we are the only ones who can save their sorry asses! So get over your overweight body, your steroid-induced shrunken testicles, your new male body! Stop crying over it! It's pathetic to think you might actually decide to kill yourselves over your horrible baggage!

If you adore those losers on Earth so much then prove it! You fight for those reasons that made you step into that tube. Because tomorrow... You're going to wake up pansies... And I'm going to wake up an asshole. Either buckle under the pressure and eject yourself from the nearest airlock or start. Being. Better.

He moves passed Jin Su, whispering.
They might be angry but, unlike your speech, they'll actually show some passion. And you call yourself a leader. Pft...

Roland :

Commander... insists on the word Just remember that one of us was not "hand-picked", but just came along because he was scared out of his wits by the mush and bought his place on board. With money earned on slavery, racket and who knows what mob relations. And he has the nerves to ask us to be better...

Jin Su :

Jin Su remains standing, straight-backed, unflinching. Then he turns his head to regard Gioele, eyes hard. That vein on his temple is twitching again.

Brown-nosing-- hrmm... hmm. His jaw works subtly, and finally he rediscovers the ability to speak. I... prefer to think of it as reminding the crew how far they've come. Leading a crew means knowing how to balance criticism with praise. And you, Mr. Rinaldo, only know how to pick at the scabs. Easy to do, but not always the most helpful.

Here we have crew who specifically asked for a pick-me-up, and you do the opposite? A slight sneer. Well done. So helpful. I have acknowledged there have been and will be hard times, and of course we have already had some casualties, from cryo or... otherwise.

I bring up past successes because the crew has already shown they are able to pull together under stressful conditions. And we can continue doing so, if you'll get off everyone's backs and take your own advice.

Gioele :

You printed a little ad-lib speech from your ever-trustful SDF guidebook. They don't need a pat on the back, they need determination. They don't deserve praise for a job not yet done. You don't compliment the cook for putting food into the pot. You're nothing more than a figure head... A "pretty face". It'll win you votes but it doesn't mean it's good for the ship. Remember that the children love mom because mom always pampers them. You're a commander fighting to save humanity, not a little league coach. Start. Acting. Like. It.

Jin Su :

Steps forward into Gioele's personal bubble.There are better ways to get results than to treat your team like dirt for not having achieved them yet. That sort of thing sends both you and them to an early grave. A flash of ferocity crosses his face. I've seen it.

Don't you forget, I've led more extra-Solar expeditions than you have summer homes. Teams that returned to parades due to their accomplishments. In spite of and sometimes because of adversity. Please, don't pretend you know my job better than I do because you know how to scrape up a mountain of cash.

Roland :

I have no intention of being sent to an early grave, but I volunteer for sending Mr Rinaldo there. As early a grave as possible, even.

Raluca :

Raluca, with her earplugs still on, observes the peculiar scene that is unfolding before her. Jin Su, with his authoritative and majestic composure, and Gioele, unrelenting and expressive in every action, getting closer and closer towards each other with every step. Their faces slowly turning red, their sweaty bodies so close to each other that their lips are almost touching.

...

Gioele :

You all accuse me of being blind to a person but yet you see me and only see my bank account. Money buys the means to a victory. You're seeing that first hand right now. Even though this ship was put together with gum and duct tape thanks to a mushy Mr. Lai squandering my funds! Now that we're here, though, money cannot purchase victory. I want to see results and, so far, I've been part of every result thus far!
He takes a step back with a frown and pats his sweaty forehead.
What would you do, then? Make it a popularity contest? Lie to them, embellish the minor things while hiding the bigger faults and expecting them to resolve themselves? I am well aware of your successes, otherwise I would not have allowed you to change my project!
He pulls out the squeaker and squeezes it, surprisingly gentle compared to other times.
There are many things this crew can do better. You ignore it. I know the SDF trains soldiers, not nannies.
The squeezing gets slower but tighter, the squeaker letting out a long wheeze.
And you're even ignoring the death threats to me. Don't you dare stand there and pretend you're a leader. A leader must be hated but feared. That keeps the team united. You leave them loose like you have and they start hating each other. You take a second and look at the problems and then you get back to me on what you plan on doing about it, aye?
He spoke calmly... Oddly, this actually feels more ferocious than him raving.

Ian :

I dont know about you, but I got a pick me up from Jin Su and then the motivation to do things better from Gioele.... Then it was ruined by your bickering.

Jin Su :

His expression remains cold, though an astute observer might notice something else there. Maybe he looks a bit... tired?

I don't give a fig for popularity. I know how to manage a mission. My history proves that, and the reason I'm not allowing you to shove me aside is because I think, cynical and bitter as you are, that you're naïve. You think that being a multi-billionaire CEO is roughly the same thing as what I do. You were good at running that operation, so why not this one?

Problem is, you had the freedom to fire people. Or they had freedom to quit. Someone could go their entire career without actually having to deal with you in person, and you could make demands freely to what amounted to numbers, not people. I don't have that luxury. On a ship as small as this, you have to keep things positive or people get bitter. Relations go sour. And there's no escape, so it does affect their work. I have responded to problems onboard this ship. You may not have noticed, because most of them were your behavior. Why would I, in good faith, turn this crew over to you?

Jin sighs, turning away from Gioele and heading back in the direction of his cot. And... these "threats." Do you really count them as serious? I can give you the rundown of why it's extremely unlikely if you need.

You don't need that little squeaky toy, Rinaldo. You don't need the pills. What you need... is to relax. And that's all I'm trying to do here. Past success gives us strength to continue, even while our failures keep us sharp for the challenges ahead.

Jin Su :

Mr. Soulton, if it were simple bickering I would not engage in it. I apologize it has come to this, but I will not abide Rinaldo sabotaging a simple pep talk in order to further his childish power-grubbing.

Gioele :

His voice goes cold.
If you think my job was to sit around in an office all day... You would be mistaken. You may know what I am on the surface but...
He pauses... Considers it for a second then shakes his head. He gives a chilling laugh.
Heh heh! Quite right... Relax... Yeahhh...
He bites his lip and returns to his own bed... Which was right next to Jin Su. How awkward.

Raluca :

Raluca's face goes tomato red seeing the two men lie down next to each other. Good...good...

Chun :

He was hissing and spreading his mushy tentacles so enthusiastically, trying to get yall attention, but to no result, alas. Anyway, while you, boys, were arguing, thanks to all the efforts of the crew.. the crew, who acted like team, we got the chance to test out the product of Ms Tomescu's astonishing abilities, and it turned out to be fruitful! Ladies and gentlemen, I'm now happy to announce this little but diverse community is now free of the fungus oppression and we've successfully accomplished the main goal of our mission! Humanity now has the cure! No more humans shall fall a victim to the ferocious parasite!

Chun :

The purpose is not to hide the transfer completly forever, that would be near impossible without infecting the old host fully again. This is a script that works with Firefox and Chrome:
- for firefox, install GreaseMonkey
https://addons.mozilla.org/en/firefox/addon/greasemonkey
- for Chrome, install TamperMonkey
https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tampermonkey/dhdgffkkebhmkfjojejmpbldmpobfkfo?hl=en

Then follow this link to install the script:
https://github.com/badconker/astropad/raw/master/astropad.user.js

Then follow this link to join this game's AstroPad:
http://mush.twinoid.com/?astroId=84516&astroKey=2c3cb8e209c76d3d01118e9ee4a1c826

Paramètres de canal : RenommerSupprimer

Drinking contest

Gioele has joined discussion.

Gioele : Drinking Game

(( Okay here are the rules. Myself, Jin Su, Chun, Hua, and Frieda have access to a D20. Each one of us will have a "drinking skill". Be true to your character on how much the points should be. Depending on the drink, it will have a "difficulty" level. You must meet say a 5 for a specific kind of drink, higher numbers for harder drinks.

For those of you without access to the dice, I'll roll for you. The people I mentioned will see those rolls so don't worry about me cheating.

Rolling a 1 or rolling lower than the difficulty will count as 1 fail. Get 5 fails total and you are knocked out cold. you can feel free to opt out at any time. If anyone else thinks of something I missed, let me know. ))

Hua has joined discussion.
Jin Su has joined discussion.
Frieda has joined discussion.
Stephen has joined discussion.
Chun has joined discussion.
Ian has joined discussion.
Paola has joined discussion.
Roland has joined discussion.
Derek has joined discussion.
Kuan Ti has joined discussion.
Janice has joined discussion.
Terrence has joined discussion.
Raluca has joined discussion.

Gioele : (( Feel free to close this tab if you don't want to participate and don't want to watch it. ))

Gioele : (( Ok, if you're participating, your first post should be your character's drinking skill. 10 is considered high. Make sure to have a reason to explain why your character has the skill they have. ))

Gioele : (( Gioele has a skill of 10. He was a space pirate back in the day and drank some of the hardest drinks that are rare to find.

This means whatever is rolled gioele will have a +10 to the number. 1 is always an instant fail no matter your skill. And 20 is always instant win. ))

Frieda : ((If an 11 were possible, she'd have it, but Frieda would be 10. She's been drinking longer than some combined-ages of other crew members and has a bionic liver. Also, witch, who likes to make herself more flammable as a bit of a dare))

Gioele : (( A bionic liver can give you a bigger boost. I'd say 11-13. ))

Frieda : ((Let's hang out in the middle then with a nice 12))

Gioele : (( Actually I just learned that you can type { d20 } without the space and get this: 2 ))

Terrence : Nice... hmm... I think I was studying, when you guys were drinking in you student days... Soo... I don't have more than 7 ))

Chun : Hm. I don't think I understood the rules much, so I'll wait till the game masters wake up to discuss first i expected hitting a certain number should make you lose instead of winning (=you drank too much and passed out)

Jin Su : ((Jin will be around a 5. He's strictly a social drinker, though as a male and a rather big fella he has a little natural tolerance. The trick will be convincing him to participate, in-character ))

Stephen : {20}

Stephen : 5

Janice : (d20)

Janice : 16 You forgot the d, didn't you?

Stephen : We both did. xD

Stephen : OH no, you just used different brackers. Nevermind. xD

Gioele : (( Okay lets say we had a drink with a difficulty of 15. I roll a 13 + 10. If this number equals or is higher than 15 then Gioele will shrug off the effects. If it's lower then the drink starts to get to him. If that happens 5 times then he passes out. ))

Terrence : (( Hehe... someone remembers 2nd edition, and skill checks there I see... ))) )))

Gioele : (( So we've got:
Gioele: 10
Hua: 10
Frieda: 12
Terrence: 7
Jin Su: 5

Do you guys want me to post a roll for everyone simultaneously or have people roll for themselves. Doing it all simultaneously would be like all of them chugging at the same time. Will get rid of someone passing out before someone else gets to take the same drink. ))

Gioele : (( Anyone else want to join? I know Paola and Chun did. ))

Paola : ((So Paola is like... a 5 from the wild times with the rebels and at college. =3))

Hua : I'd like to add one more rule to this contest, might took it three days to complete, but who cares? The humans and mush alike have already waited for sixteen years and it's not like they're going anywhere, aaarrr!
As pirates, bionic-witches, and... snort pansies, methinks we should take this opportunity not only to share booze, but stories as well.
Fer each drinking round, one contestant must come up with one story o'his own. Doesn't have to be true. Doesn't have to be YER story. Could have happen'd to some old jack.

And of course, that won't change the rules, the last one standing wins the game, and the loser will mop the bridge, middle, and lower decks for a week, aarrr. That's what drinking contest are for!

Gioele : (( That sounds great! You guys will like it when Gioele gets 3 fails.

Here's an example roll. I think it's best if I just roll for everyone to play it as though everyone chugs a glass at the same time. Then we can react and rp to our rolls. Here's an example:

Frieda: 14 +12
Gioele: 5 +10
Hua: 6 +10
Terrence: 12 +7
Jin Su: 5 +5
Paola: 17 +5
Curley Sue 2: 15 +3
Chun: 14 +2

Difficulty to meet: 20. ))

Gioele : (( So in that roll. Gioele, Hua, Terrence, Jin, Curley, and Chun all get 1 fail. We'll be free to post for a bit until people are ready for the next round of drink. Paola and Frieda shrug off the drink's effects. ))

Roland : ((Hmpf. Eleesha would be a 9, but Roland... I don't know the guy enough, you just, never been drunk in this body before. Let's make that a... 7 ?))

Gioele : (( That's fine. We might start this on C1. If someone really wants to jump in in the middle, they can, but the crew will force them to take "catch up" drinks. I'd prefer everyone that wants to join to speak up before we start, though. ))

Stephen : Count me in! This'll be awesome! ((I love this crew so much :'D ))

Gioele : (( What's Stephen's Drinking skill? ))

A little more than a dozen of various shaped bottles, all hand-labeled, containing suspicious colored liquids.

They're made from a wide range of alien plants, fruits, which I've carefully and scrupulously collected on my exploration.
This gestures at the crate are the fruit of years of labor and research, experiencing, mixing, tasting, selecting the rarest breeds that would make the finest booze in all Sol. (I haven't taste Frieda's special one yet. Pats at her inside pocket to make sure the vial is still here. )

Hua : Snorts. I thought you were a connoisseur... But you'd rather drink CAMEL PISS over MY precious liqueurs? Points an angry finger at Rinaldo's wrinkled face.
I've spent DECADES traveling across the galaxy and searching for the most exquisite alien species I could find.
THIS, is a rare blend of carnivorous heliotropus fermented seed from the Lalande 21185 system. And THIS ONE, is made of Naumachia's Hydregealus Ghost flowers, a plant that can only survive in the dark side of the planet and blossoms on day on all the Naumachian year (985 terrestrial days), and for which my colleague DIED. It's unique in the whole known world, ya rich jerk! And THIS OVER THERE, is inspired from a thousands-years-old chinese recipe, requiring near a hundred of special ingredient, including Mankarog's toe-nails, living sandworm larvaes, and some conscious Tau-Ceti's mushrooms! AND YOU are just an ungrateful, uneducated, bilge-piss-drinking, moronic, shithead, stupid, old, fat, grumpy, worthless, retarded, scurvy SON OF A BISCUIT EATER.
Shuts her crate with a loud clink.

Let's try the blue stuff.

He rises and stalks over to the kitchen counter, where a few well-placed knocks causes a tiny, previously-unseen panel to pop open. Jin Su squats down low to allow a camera to perform a retinal scan, and the mechanism beeps a little tune, a distinct unlatching sound audible. The Commander slides the whole counter wall to the side, fog spilling out and spreading across the floor. He retrieves several packets from within and lays them out on the tabletop: cookies, crackers, and even some dips and cheeses to enjoy them with.

Paola : Slightly glazed over humming.

Chun : Isn't it time for having fun already? she stares at her wrist, like if there was a watch Because I think it is! We will start dieing of boredome soon, people! Well, at least I will. Paola : Yeah! Go Chun! Whoo!

Tipsy. Very tipsy. He can't help but chuckle a bit at her antics, singing and dancing, and he allows her to lead him along for a few minutes. His upper half stays very stiff and balanced, but anyone looking at his feet might be able to recognize hints of complex footwork.

Just, ah... give us a shout when the next round is up? He smiles and shrugs at those still at the table.

Chun : After a descent portion of arm-flailing and foot-grinding (she even somehow managed to roll him over her back, whoa!.. who could even imagine that thin as a branch of precatus body is capable of such endeavor!) That feels soooooo good! tips back with pleasure Heh, you're quite a hot mess, commander!

Roland : Roland stares at Chun with slightly unfocused eyes, wondering if she had some kind of pill or smoke as well as the drinks. Chun, are you all r... Oh, never mind, she's just completely hammered. He goes to the lab and opens the cryo module, from which he pulls out a frozen bottle. The liquid in it, slightly blurred behind the frost, is blue with tiny orange bubbles. Sitting back at the table, he uncorks the bottle and the bubbles immediately start to rise up its neck and float in the room, becoming green before they pop like bubbles of chewing-gum. A strange smell, a mixture of lime, coke and sweet dessert wine, starts to invade the room. There you go, he says with a smirk. Just try not to light a match in the room, and hope that we don't get even a tiny electrical spark from the ceiling.

Gioele : Gioele watches with surprise as Roland decides that he didn't want any of the odd drink he had pushed towards him and got up to get a different one. As the drink was poured, and the room grew loud with popping noises, he took a second to study the bottle from afar. With a shrug, he downed it.

It was actually deceptively tasty. It wasn't sweet but it was really smooth. While the alcohol doesn't seem to burn as much as some of the other hard drinks, you can still feels its effects almost immediately... Also there's the sinking feeling that you just committed a crime against nature.

He got up and grabbed her cup and filled it with water.
Drink that and stop touching me! Hrmph!
He shakes his head and reaches in his pocket and pulls out a picture. He tosses it on the table.
I bet you fools can't guess which one is me.

Five people were on the picture. Four males and one female. On the left you could see a muscled man with black hair. He has a winning smile and seemed to be leaning on another person. He's wearing a white tank top. Above him you can see the name "Knight".

The unfortunate one being used as a pillar to lean on seems to be no more than in his late teens. Light brown hair and a wide, confident smile. You can see him holding what looks to be a small drone. Under him is written "Six".

In the middle picture you can see a woman. Her eyes cold, staring at the camera with only the slightest smirk. Dyed, dark red hair partially covered by a cliche old pirate hat. Her stance made you think she was in charge... Written above her: "Scarecrow".

To the right was a dark skinned gentleman in a pristine suit. His posture was that of a respectful individual. Carefully sculpted black hair and a calm smile. Somehow it's familiar to you. The name is scribbled out with "Dick" written underneath it and in different ink from the others. On closer inspection, it was easy to see that the name was "Cy".

The final man was at the far left. He had tattoos running up both arms and a dragon on his face. The mouth of the dragon was opening up on his upper lip where you can see a mustache. You're not sure but you get the feeling that the mustache was supposed to be fire. It really doesn't work. Under him you see the name "Chaos".

Frieda : Hm...you're the porky one, aren't you? The one in the suit with the self satisfied grin? Also, this "Chaos"...Is that Charles? I think I may been married to him at one point...

Gioele : Open your eyes, do I look black!? Are you going blind now, you old crone?

Frieda : If I look at your for too long I feel queasy so I haven't really done much staring, Rinaldo. You could be orange for all I care. Frieda takes a second look, a fraction of a second longer than the one before, and looks a little green afterwards Oh dear God you are orange.

Gioele : He nods and Jin Su with an oddly amused smirk.
Yeah. I'm the meathead there. Healthy, handsome, and a colossal idiot.
His eyes dart to the kid labeled "Six" and his smile wanes.
This was after we "saved" a backwater colony. We were just explorers at this point. Searching for wrecks in order to gain a fun bounty, maybe get into a fight with some alien race. We did, indeed. I had left home because I didn't really like the idea of being a prison warden.
He glances at Paola and chuckles mildly.
And you all thought she got her rebellious personality from her mother.
He opens his mouth to keep speaking but closes it again and looks around the room, his cheeks were red.
Someone else's turn to tell a story.

Jin Su : Hm, never came across any records of this in your history. ...Imagine that's for a reason. Jin snags another cracker from the table and munches it thoughtfully. I think most of you lot have heard all my stories by now, though. The ones worth telling, at least.

Raluca : My, what a marvelous drink! To think you cretins are capable of producing such a thing, perhaps I may have some use for you after all. Glug glug glug. Hic! Well then, a story you say? Gioele : ... I hate aliens.
He grumbles and leaves the room for a few minutes then returned with an unmarked, brown bottle. The blandness of the bottle makes you feel uneasy. It's the ones without the pzazz that are the ones that hit you where it hurts.
This... Is a sacred grog mixture. There's a planet with a kingdom or hardcore LARPers. Stifle your giggles... When I say hardcore, I mean the middle ages revisited. Bloody, dark, and dirty.
He sits back with the sealed bottle in hand.
I've heard of people dying from this. I've had it, myself. I don't really remember what it was like. The ship was pretty thrashed afterwards, though and I woke up next to a lot of new faces. Not all of them female.
He chuckles mildly.
Wasn't really new for me back then, though. Between hard alcohol and drug sampling... well... I'm quite sure Paola has a few unmet siblings out in the universe somewhere.
He pulls the cap off. You heal a hiss and can smell it. It smells terrible.

Then tries to center it, but... eh, close enough. Wow. That's some... powerful stuff. Mmrh... Zuccali, please... please don't try that.

Roland : Try what, shir ? Dying ?

Paola : Is still seesawing between snoring and mumbling. Eleesha's outburst, however, causes her to murmur something incoherent and fasten herself to her leg, apparently all without waking up.

Jin Su : Waves his hand. You've already done it once, but try not to do it a second time. He glares into space for a few seconds before the expression breaks down into a grin. I'm just kidding, Roleesha. I'm not confused about it like some people are.

Hua : A reddish glow gains Hua's cheeks, as she starts to sway a little on her creaking chair.
She's just cleared out her cup in one go, and might unmistakably have overestimated a bit the LARPers brewing skills - what a bunch of medieval freaks, who could drink that?! - to her great surprise. The searing sensation spreads at light-speed along her nerve endings, electrifying her body in a weird, flushing, warm shake.
WOW!
Never felt such a jolt since my first landing, and that time we were surrounded by lava, and the engine was refusing to start... Wowowooo. After that one, I could almost ride a comet, and orbit around a two stars-system for a while before considering racing through the Great Asteroid belt. Shakes her head, and slams her cup on the table.

She rocks on her seat for a minute, leaving the other a chance to deal with the after-effects of the beverage and the recent appearances of both Mortimer and Curly Sue; before stretching her hand to grab the small lamp in the middle of the table and... switch it off.

Hua : A minute or two pass in the dark, heavy atmosphere of the kitchen.
Strange noises are heard. Has the Coffee-kraken awake again? Or Chun's special pet? Is it Mister Squawkers' ghost haunting his former mates? Or could it only be Paola's snoring, Jin Su helping himself to more crakers and Frieda's knitting needles?
Do we really want to know?

After a while, you heard a match cracking.
The gloom is shredded by the sudden display of Hua's face, illuminated from below by a small flickering candle.
The time is ripe for stories.
This old pirate tale, I heard long time ago. Repeated amongst drunkards, travellers, starsailors and other bandits. Some details where often fought about, many talk of that story as a metaphor or boozer errands, but all legends - even the craziest ones - have a bit o' truth in them, that much I know.

It goes like this :

Jin Su : Jin settles back in his chair, softly humming that shanty to himself again. It just seems fitting.

Hua : There was once a famous Pirate, as feared as he was valued among his peers.
It was troubled times. Before the Federation's men starts to scrupulously map and claim the known world as theirs. Most of the colonies where unknown and savage dangerous places, wild lands, rough asteroids, anything that could be used as an hideout for rogue and crooks: you were sure to find black market and bootleggers around.
Cargoes' captains were known to hire mercenaries to help save their goods from pirates, but this one...
His name (one of the details regulars disagree on) was enough to make any grown man shit his pants and leave without a second look. No one would have dare crossing his road, as he had the reputation to be merciless and exceptionally cruel.
'No quarter', was his motto, so how people knew he was such a devil? Aaarrr.
No idea. Might have been the heap of floating mutilated corpses he left in his wake, might have been the thousands of shipwrecks sacked to the bones, the long list of ruined ship-owners who committed suicide after loosing crew and merchandise to this man's unquenchable greed...

Very little is known about the man himself, even less 'bout his crew.
Tales like to depict him as a monstrous creature, kind of an alien Demon, people unbelieving an actual man could demonstrate such gruesome barbarism.. Yet, this is mainly the point that'd make me think he was, indeed, human.
Was he tall? Dark haired? One-eyed? Eh. No one has ever met him and lived to tell. Yet, there's one small fact about which all stories meet.
It is said, he fancied wearing an old worn-out blanket for a cape. A piece of tattered fabric, faded and filthy. Why, on the Great Nebula, a rich pirate would wear such a thing? Mystery.
Yet, and that has been made pretty certain from the many spacecrafts he plundered, he was at this time probably the wealthiest person in the galaxy. That's were the legend become interesting. His treasure was so massive, he'd have need a whole planet to hide his loot. A hidden planet.. Far. Far enough from the known-world so nobody could find it by chance, yet on his reach. Secluded. According to the years of the attacks and the small periods of calm, he'd likely made six trips along his tremendous career to his secret-planet to drop off his valuables. And while none of his former crewmates has ever outlive him (it's likely he murdered his whole crew after each trip cause dead men tell no tales) ; while many men have tried, in vain, to crack the planet's location secret, blinding themselves in false hopes goggling at their maps, and died in their ignorance and foolishness...
Part of the legend implies the Pirate would have had to left clues behind, a crypted mean for him to find his planet again - one code only real Pirates could break - for his seventh and last trip.
Some says he made it his final resting place and enjoyed his gold 'till the end of his days. But happy endings are total bullshit. Other says the Federation caught and killed him. Though, many thinks that's only propaganda, and that those SDF nitwits couldn't kill a legend like him.. Anyhow, he seems to have met his fate, since his piracy days ended, leaving the stars in peace. May Delzoup have his soul... Assuming he had one.

She blows the candle, and in the dark, her hoarse voice echoes one last time.
And that's all for the story of the lost treasure of the Cap'tain Bad Blanket, named after his weird cape.

Stephen : Stephen stands clapping. Clearly impressed by Hua's story telling abilities. He slams back down into his chair and puts his hand on his palms ready for another. He then burps and starts eating some BBQ ribs he prepared before the drinking game. Oh yes, I forgot. I got some food here for us!

Jin Su : Jin squints. I've heard that name 'afore... though that tale's more complete than any version I ever heard. Has to be legend, though. No pirate could fool scanning technology in this day 'n' age, could he? He glances over at the ribs Stephen had brought out and enthusiastically helps himself to some. Still... a good yarn, an' well told.

Hua : Looks like I've no competition here. WHERE ARE YOU PEOPLE?! Are you already scared... Or sleepy like cry-babies? Bends under the table to check who's there.
I can't hear you begging for the next round! Where's the booze damn it? I'm here to get wasted, not watching you snore! GIOELE, ya cranky ol'fart are you already begging to stap? Thought you were tougher than that... Eh.

Roland : We're not sh... sleepy, we're just ham... hammered. But maybe it w... would help to have a cocktail with shamp-p-poo and champagne... hey, we could c... call that shampagne, or champoo. That's shoooo cool.

Jin Su : Well here, how 'bout, eh... Jin Su stands and wobbles in a dignified fashion over to Hua's liquor trunk, snatching a dangerous-looking bottle.

Lots of bright colors on the bottle, including a tattoo-style image of a dragon wrapped around the entire thing. How 'bout this one? Looks... fierce.

The Commander pops it open and there's a noise like a blaster shot! A bright red foam spills over the lip of the bottle, and he focuses very carefully on getting some in all the glasses with minimum spillage.

Not like having your fighter on fire. That's the bad way. He chuckles at his own "joke" and begins singing snatches of a shanty to himself. He only seems to remember half the words, but between the bouts of humming it appears to be a song about a crew bravely battling a ship fire.

Jin Su : Jin looks around the table and laughs openly. Ha! This is a celebration? You all're too coo... too quiet! More rum, more, more!

He's back in Hua's trunk, rotating bottles around, looking for one that literally says "rum" on it. Finally, success! A square bottle, quite large, with "Not Yer Momma's Rum" in calligraphic letters. Jin brings the label very close to his face and squints. The label's texture and design is like a real treasure map! And it says "rum!" He chortles deeply and does an odd half-stumble, half-dance back to his seat.

♫ Stick out yer glass an' I'll pour ye some,
Splash the back o' yer throat with this 'ere rum! ♪

It's a good thing the bottle is so big, because despite Jin's best efforts, it ends up all over the place as he pours the round.

It's definitely not regular rum. Much, much stronger, and yet it doesn't seem that way at first. Or maybe you're just too drunk to be able to tell the difference, by this point.

Jin Su : Oh right, how could I have forgotten. 'Cos a speedo is definitely a hic normal work uniform, min... mandated by people not intending to enjoy th'view. Said nothin' about love. He seems to pout for a few moments, until his mental gears shift suddenly, and he smiles devilishly. It's still a fairly subtle expression, but it still manages to look incredibly out of place. Could serve you that drink now, y'know. Final round up next, eh?

Stephen : He looks dead into Frieda's eye's and you can see the intend on his face, he's determined to do whatever he has in mind. He grabs his drink and slams it down his throat and slowly and dramatically puts the glass back down onto the table Frieda..he burps You and me. He starts to get emotional, you know he is very drink now as he has not acted like this before while on the ship It's just all you guys, it's been so much fun. He starts to cry. None of you know why, he's just very drunk and rambling -...I mean, I didn't mean to kill him. He just transferred into Eleesha and that hurt me. He rambles on for ages I don't even know what the Teslatron does, so how was I supposed to know where it went? Jin Su : Looks at Eleesha with comical disgust. A shpeedo? I daresay not. But to not dish... disappoint Miz Frieda, I will meet 'er halfway. He attacks his vest buttons with gusto, fumbling with them with uncoordinated fingers until finally conquering them. The black turtleneck is next. Jin Su : The "whale" remark is actually more apt than Jin would care to admit. His exposed torso shows him to be a rather barrel-chested man, with more of an even, soft coating of fat than giant, sagging lumps of it. He waves Eleesha off with a free hand.

O'courshe not, you don't get the full show so easily. An' the cape makes it fancy. Gotta hic be fancy if yer gonna serve drinks, 'ey?

♪ Poured by th' hand of a good-lookin' gir- er, guy,
Tip yer mugs up now, an' let the booze swir- uh, fly... ♫

The Commander suddenly turns on his heel, cape flaring dramatically. (He doesn't even lose his balance for long afterward!) In his hand is a steel bottle, imprinted with a logo in bold letters: Black Spot Grog.

Now thish looks interesh- ...inter- ...good. Good luck to both o' ya.

He pours the glasses. Predictably, the drink is black, and... seems to be steaming? Sliding one glass in front of Stephen and one in front of Frieda, Jin lounges casually against the table, awaiting the outcome.
